pullRequest.body:
Take the lemmas about monotonicity of functions out of Data/Set/Function and move them to Data/Set/Monotone.

Also remove `Compl.decidableMem`, as it is already given in `decidableCompl` (instance search already finds it too)

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

You can run `scripts/import_trans_difference.sh all` locally to see the whole output.

</details>

---

`- Compl.decidableMem`

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

```suggestion
import Mathlib.Data.Set.Function
```
I don't see ι or π being used below; please check what you can trim from the `variable`s and `open`s
Ooh good point. I wonder if #17261 would have detected this for me!
I am quite confident that it would have, but the linter is still work-in-progress.

I decided to run the linter on the files modified in this PR.  Besides lots of accumulated unused variables upstream of the files here, this is the report:
```
ℹ [333/334] Replayed Mathlib.Data.Set.Function
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Function.lean:169:28: 't' is unused
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Function.lean:170:45: 'b' is unused
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Function.lean:453:10: 'U' is unused
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Function.lean:169:58: 'f' is unused
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Function.lean:169:46: 'p' is unused
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Function.lean:170:3: 'f'' is unused
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Function.lean:169:81: 'g₁' is unused
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Function.lean:169:33: 't₂' is unused
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Function.lean:169:84: 'g₂' is unused
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Function.lean:169:30: 't₁' is unused
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Function.lean:236:66: 'f₃' is unused
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Function.lean:170:10: 'f₂'' is unused
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Function.lean:170:24: 'g'' is unused
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Function.lean:170:6: 'f₁'' is unused
ℹ [334/334] Replayed Mathlib.Data.Set.Monotone
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Monotone.lean:60:12: 's₁' is unused
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Monotone.lean:14:26: 'ι' is unused
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Monotone.lean:14:38: 'π' is unused
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Monotone.lean:60:33: 'f₂' is unused
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Monotone.lean:159:60: 's' is unused
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Monotone.lean:159:62: 't' is unused
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Monotone.lean:159:36: 'f' is unused
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Monotone.lean:60:30: 'f₁' is unused
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Monotone.lean:159:10: 'fa' is unused
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Monotone.lean:159:23: 'fb' is unused
info: ././././Mathlib/Data/Set/Monotone.lean:159:48: 'g' is unused
```
Thanks, super helpful!
If you want, I can also push the changes to the other file: I cannot add them as suggestions, since they are on unmodified lines.
Yes, please feel free!
Done!

```suggestion
```
Found by the linter.

```suggestion
variable {s s₂ : Set α} {f : α → β} [Preorder α] [Preorder β]
```
found by the linter.

```suggestion
variable {α β γ : Type*}
```
found by the linter (and Ruben!).
Can this be under `Order`? `Order.Monotone.Set` maybe?

I'm not convinced by that name - a good chunk of the lemmas in `Order.Monotone` involve `Set` anyway, so it's not a good disambiguator. More specifically, what would be the deciding factor for a new lemma going in `Order.Monotone.Set` as opposed to any one of the other files in `Order.Monotone`?
I think there's little to none, which surely is an argument *for* putting the files close together or even merge them?
I'm not opposed to putting the files close together, I just don't think `Order.Monotone.Set` is a good name for the new file!
`Order.Monotone.SetFunction`? 🤷
I would kind of suggest straight up merging them. No naming issue then

Ah, now I see the issue. Order/Monotone/Basic is very low in the import hierarchy - it cannot import `Set.preimage`, for instance. So merging with that is not an option, and merging with any of the other files there doesn't make sense either.

> Order/Monotone/Basic is very low in the import hierarchy - it cannot import `Set.preimage`, for instance.

What do you mean exactly? Nothing complains when I import `Data.Set.Operations` in `Order.Monotone.Basic` (and `Data.Set.Operations` is meant to be a very very low import btw)
See https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/809c3fb3b5c8f5d7dace56e200b426187516535a/Mathlib/Order/Monotone/Basic.lean#L150, for instance.
More importantly, the lemmas in this file use lemmas from `Data.Set.Function`, which also creates an import cycle.

> See
> 
> https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/809c3fb3b5c8f5d7dace56e200b426187516535a/Mathlib/Order/Monotone/Basic.lean#L150
> 
> , for instance.

Sounds like the "right now" is very outdated

> the lemmas in this file use lemmas from `Data.Set.Function`

Where? I don't see any lemma from `Data.Set.Function` being used. I see definitions being used, but those could move to `Data.Set.Operations`

Unfortunately it is not just definitions that are used here, lemmas from `Data.Set.Function` are used in the file. Furthermore, even if it were only definitions being used, it is out of scope of this PR to additionally move around definitions.
Okay, but merging was merely a suggestion for how to put the material under `Order.Monotone`. Please move this new file under `Order.Monotone`

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Data/Set): split Data/Set/Function
